verbose_text: Given the central and essential role of KNL1 in mediating proper chromosome segregation, Spindle Assembly Checkpoint signaling, and directing error correction of improper kinetochore-microtubule attachments, it is surprising that the KNL1 c.6125G> A point mutation in KNL1 leads to a brain specific phenotype, whereas another point mutation (KNL1 c.6673-19T> A) affects lymphoblastoid and fibroblast cells.
evidence: KNL1 in mediating proper chromosome segregation
